intro: Sicyos acariaeanthus, commonly known as the spiny bottle gourd, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is a climbing vine that produces large, spiny fruits with a thick, waxy rind. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Its leaves are broad and lobed, with a hairy surface. The flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female blooms, typical of the gourd family.
